text: Helsingør Dagblad is a Danish language local newspaper based in Helsingør, Denmark. ==History and profile== Helsingør Dagblad was established by Henrik Donatzky, a publisher, in 1867. The paper is part of North Media and is published by Søndagsavisen A/S which is also the publisher of Søndagsavisen. The former publisher of the paper was Helsingør Dagblad A/S Group. Søndagsavisen A/S had a stake in the company until 2009 when it purchased the company from Dansk AvisTryk A/S. The paper is published in North Zealand. In March 2017 Dorthe Carlsen was appointed director of the paper, replacing Svein Gilbu in the post. ==References== ==External links== * Official website Category:Danish-language newspapers Category:Newspapers published in Denmark Category:Publications established in 1867 Category:1867 establishments in Denmark Category:Danish companies established in 1867
title: Helsingør Dagblad
